original_title: Buwanekabahu Perera appointed CEO of Ceylon Chamber of Commerce
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Buwanekabahu Perera has been appointed as the Chief Executive and Secretary General of the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce, a statement said.
The veteran banker will succeed Manjula de Silva, who is retiring, on May 08, a statement from the chamber said.
Perera who held positions as the Director/Senior Vice President of the NDB Investment Bank Ltd., and as the Senior Vice President at NDB Bank Ltd.
He currently serves on the Boards of Sierra Construction Ltd, Cargills Bank Ltd, and Sierra Cables Plc.

Perera was also the Past President of the Association of Professional Bankers of Sri Lanka, past Chairman of the Bankers Association Technical Advisory Committee, as well as the Sri Lanka China Business Council of the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce.
Meanwhile Alikie Perera will continue in her role as the Deputy Secretary General and Chief Operating Officer of the Ceylon Chamber, as well as its Financial Controller. (Colombo/ May08/2023)
